questions.text: Etienne finds four performance examples but knows there should only be three. Which one is mislabelled as a performance example?
options: The system must automatically generate an insurance claim form.
Response time must not exceed four seconds.
The online inventory control system must flag all low-stock items within one hour after the quantity falls below a predetermined minimum.
The records system must produce key reports within five hours of the end of each fiscal quarter.
questions.correctAnswer: The system must automatically generate an insurance claim form.
questions.explanation: Automatically generating a form describes a process requirement, not a performance metric.

questions.text: In a JAD session, whose name would be placed next to the final task on the agenda for documenting results and preparing the report?
questions.explanation: The recorder, Zanele, is responsible for documenting JAD results and preparing the summary report.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a guideline for using structured English?
questions.explanation: Structured English uses control structures, indentation, and limited vocabulary, but not pseudocode.

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding RFPs and RFQs?
options: An RFP is more specific than an RFQ.
When Simone is tasked with the job, Sepang already knows the specific product or service he wants and he needs to obtain price quotations or bids.
When Marny is tasked with the job, her output can involve outright purchase or a variety of leasing options.
RFPs and RFQs have very different objectives.
questions.correctAnswer: RFPs and RFQs have very different objectives.
questions.explanation: RFPs request solution proposals, while RFQs request pricing for already-defined items.

questions.text: Which of the following is a reason Sarah will share with new analysts for recommending a client to purchase a software package?
options: The client wants to develop internal resources and capabilities.
The client is looking for the lowest possible costs.
The client has unique business requirements that must be satisfied by this software application.
The client has some existing technology whose requirements must be met by the new software.
questions.correctAnswer: The client has some existing technology whose requirements must be met by the new software.
questions.explanation: Clients buy off-the-shelf software when integration with existing technology is key.

questions.text: Which of the following is a reason Sarah would give for in-house software development?
options: The client is looking to spend the least possible time in implementation.
The client wants to be able to use fewer technical development staff members.
The client has a number of very distinctive security requirements.
The client wishes to receive future upgrades from the vendors.
questions.correctAnswer: The client has a number of very distinctive security requirements.
questions.explanation: In-house development allows customization for specific or sensitive security needs.

questions.text: Thabang’s team has weak communication skills. Which system development method is he least likely to use?
questions.explanation: Agile methods rely heavily on collaboration and communication, making them unsuitable for teams with weak communication.

questions.text: Rose joins a project where the systems requirement document is nearly complete. In which SDLC phase is the team?
questions.explanation: The systems requirement document is the deliverable of the systems analysis phase.

questions.text: Etienne finds a system requirement stating: 'An employee record must be added, changed, or deleted only by HR staff.' What category does this requirement best fit?
questions.explanation: This defines an access restriction, which falls under control requirements.

questions.text: Bala assigns a project manager to ensure a new project is completed on time. This is an example of _____.
questions.explanation: Schedule feasibility assesses whether the project can be completed within a set timeframe.

questions.text: In a JAD session, whose name should go next to the agenda point explaining the reason for the project at the outset?
questions.explanation: The representative from top management, Sepang, explains the project's strategic purpose.

questions.text: David identifies the problem with structured English being used incorrectly. Which issue indicates incorrect use?
options: It is not using a sequence, selection, or iteration structure.
It is shorthand for actual code.
questions.correctAnswer: It is not using a sequence, selection, or iteration structure.
questions.explanation: Structured English must be based on three control structures: sequence, selection, and iteration.

questions.text: Analysts at Zansi InfoSystems consider the four-model approach. What is a likely outcome if they use it?
options: Time taken to develop the model increases.
Costs needed to develop logical and physical models of the current system will be less.
It will not be possible to get a clear picture of the current system before modifications.
The requirements of a new system will always differ from the current one.
questions.correctAnswer: Time taken to develop the model increases.
questions.explanation: Developing four models (logical and physical for both current and proposed systems) takes more time.
